message_1: Given the propositions P: "It rains today" and Q: "You bring your umbrella", form the negation of the compound proposition "If it rains today, then you bring your umbrella" and express it in symbolic form using logical operators.
message_2:
The compound proposition "If it rains today, then you bring your umbrella" can be represented as an implication: P → Q. The negation of this implication is ¬(P → Q).

Using the equivalence between an implication and its disjunction form, we can rewrite the negation as follows:

¬(P → Q) ≡ ¬(¬P ∨ Q) ≡ P ∧ ¬Q

So, the negation of the compound proposition is "It rains today and you do not bring your umbrella", which is symbolically represented as P ∧ ¬Q.
